itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer, and sprinter

wikipedia_page.main: Stanley "Stan" Brogden (15 March 1910 – 18 June 1981) was an English rugby union, and professional sprinter and rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s. He played representative level rugby league (RL) for Great Britain and England, and at club level for Bradford Northern (two spells, including one as a World War II guest), Huddersfield, Leeds, Hull FC, Rochdale Hornets, St Helens R.F.C. and Salford, as a wing, centre, or stand-off, i.e. number 2 or 5, 3 or 4, or 6, and representative level rugby union (RU) for British Empire Forces,
